item.title: HLSL pitfalls
item.description: I've encountered several issues of HLSL, and lucky enough found most workaround/solution on internet. It doesn't feel right for anyone to remember all these. Denormalized float, small float/large uint This is a FXC only issue. First, there is asfloat(0x7FFFFF) => 0 from Low-level Shader Optimization for Next-Gen and DX11 by Emil Persson. That is, asfloat always gives 0 if you feed bits fit denormalized pattern. Then, floats smaller than 1e-6 won't make their way into output.

item.title: Wave Intrinsics Hello World
item.description: After work with DirectX 12 for a while, with some need to validate shader using Wave Intrinsics, I wrote a hello world as a playground. To keep things simple, here are some decisions made in advance. Wave Intrinsics DirectX 12 Shader Model 6.0+ DirectXShaderCompiler (DXC) Minimal setup Console program No window No swapchain No render loop Compute Shader only No descriptor heap Minimum abstraction No error handling (except shader compilation) Debugging Read back output through UAV printf Result Here is the repo ComputeShaderPlayground on Github.
